info.description: This is API documentation for Gunak Platform
info.title: Gunak Platform

tags.name: Login
tags.description: Before accessing the API to get the assessment data the api should login. Gunak uses cookie based session management.

tags.name: Assessment
tags.description: There are three key aspects of an assessment for an API user - Facility, Assessment Tool and Assessment Instance. An assessment is done for a facility. For doing the assessment an assessment tool is used. A program can have one or more assessment tools. An example is - Program = 'Laqshya', Assessment tool = 'NQAS', 'Laqshya Monthly', 'Laqshya Baseline'. Assessment tool consists of one or more checklists. Using the same example - NQAS has 'OT' and 'Labour Room'. Lastly a facility can be assessed multiple times using the same assessment tool. A single instance of assessment could be divided among more than one assessor. For example - one assessor could do 'OT' and other one could do 'Labour Room'. When the assessors use single series name from the app, Gunak collects them into a single assessment.

post.summary: Some of API methods may be protected, hence the caller must login before calling those APIs.
post.description: Post the login details to the server to obtain a valid cookie by name JSESSIONID. Include this cookie in other API calls that are protected.

401.description: Login failed, email and password combination incorrect

get.summary: Assessment Listing - Get facility assessments after the given date-time.
get.description: Get a list of facility assessments completed after a date. Each Assessment has an assessment date on which it was submitted to the system. Depending on the date-time value passed the API will return a paged list of all assessments submitted after that time (including exact match).

parameters.name: assessmentEndDateTime
parameters.description: Timestamp (date and time) value. The assessments returned will be all have assessmentEndDateTime on or after this value. The datetime value should be specified in the following format - yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ, e.g. "2000-10-31T01:30:00.000Z".

parameters.name: assessmentToolName
parameters.description: Name of the assessment tool under the program whose assessments should be returned

get.summary: Get all checkpoint scores and indicators of an assessment.
get.description: Each assessment has a globally unique systemId which identifies an assessment. This systemId can be retrived from the assessment listing api call.

pageParam.name: page
pageParam.description: Page number, starts with 0. But please note you will always receive the first page which may not be what you may want.

pageSizeParam.name: size
pageSizeParam.description: Number of resources to include in a page

APIError.description: Gunak uses standard HTTP status codes for communicating about various error codes. In the API error response please check the status code. Apart from the standard error, API error contains application specific error messages as well. https://www.restapitutorial.com/httpstatuscodes.html

PageDetails.description: Used when the number of resources in the response is large and cannot be sent in one response to the called. In such a case the results are returned in multiple pages. Along with the resources, PageDetails is part of response providing information to the user to navigate through all the pages to fetch all the resources. For the example - Assume there are 89 resources. Each page size is of 20 resources. Total number of pages = 89/20 = 5 (rounded up). Currently in page number 2 (0 based).

totalPages.description: Total number of pages of response

totalElements.description: Total number of resources in all the pages put together

size.description: Maximum number of elements in a page

number.description: The current page number (starts from 0, upto totalPages - 1)

numberOfElements.description: Number of elements in the current page

CheckpointAssessment.description: Checkpoint is the small unit of assessment in an assessment tool. A checkpoint is scored as 0, 1 or 2. A checkpoint can also be marked as not-applicable by the assessor during the assessment and in that case the score is not provided. Checkpoints do not have a reference id like measurable element, standard or area of concern.

checkpoint.example: There is no unauthorised occupation within the facility, nor there is encroachment on Hospital land

remarks.example: There is a part of land under litigation.

MeasurableElementAssessment.description: In an assessment tool, measurable element consists of checkpoints. Correspondingly, in an assessment, the measurable element consists of checkpoint scores.

StandardAssessment.description: In an assessment tool, standard consists of measurable elements. Correspondingly, in an assessment, their scores are grouped within a measurable element.

AreaOfConcernAssessment.description: In an assessment tool, area of concern consists of standards. Correspondingly, in an assessment, their scores are grouped within a standards.

ChecklistAssessment.description: In an assessment tool, checklist consists of area of concerns. Correspondingly, in an assessment, their scores are grouped within a area of concerns.
